pages.text: Vadarocrinus is a petalocrinid crinoid from the Devonian period. It was similar to Petalocrinus in that it had 5 petal shaped extensions from the end of its stalk, making look like an underwater flower. It lived attached to the seafloor as a suspension feeder.
